CalcServer.description: A calculator server with basic arithmetic operations, trigonometric functions, resource management, sampling capabilities, and prompt templates

add.description: Adds two numbers a and b together and returns the sum

ambiguous_add.description: Adds two numbers together but only accepts 'a' input and uses elicitation to request 'b' input from the user

cos.description: Calculates the cosine of an angle in radians (disabled by default)

sin.description: Calculates the sine of an angle in radians (disabled by default)

set_trig_allowed.description: Enables or disables trigonometric functions (cos and sin) per-client

write_special_number.description: Updates the special number resource with a new value

eval_with_sampling.description: Evaluates a string arithmetic expression using LLM sampling to parse and compute the result

resource://special-number.description: A mutable number resource that can be read and updated via tools

example-maths.description: A prompt template that helps with mathematical problem solving

FileServer.description: A server that provides file system access with resource templates and subscriptions

write_file.description: Writes content to a file at the specified path

delete_file.description: Deletes a file at the specified path

file:///{path}.description: Access any file by providing its path

path.description: The file path relative to the root directory

code_review.description: Analyzes code quality and suggests improvements

summarize_file.description: Summarizes the content of a file at the given path

ErrorServer.description: A server designed to test error handling and edge cases

always_error.description: Always returns a tool execution error

timeout.description: Takes a long time to execute, useful for testing timeouts

invalid_response.description: Returns a response that doesn't match its declared schema

error://not-found.description: A resource that always returns not found error

scenarios.description: client1 connects to CalcServer and calls add(a=10, b=20), gets result of 30
client1 connects to CalcServer and calls ambiguous_add(a=10), receives elicitation for b, responds with 20, gets result of 30
client1 & client2 connect to CalcServer; client1 calls set_trig_allowed(allowed=true) tool. client1 gets list of tools that includes cos & sin, and client2 gets list of tools that doesn't
client1 connects to CalcServer, reads resource://special-number (initial value 42), calls write_special_number(value=100), then reads resource://special-number again and gets 100
client1 connects to CalcServer, calls prompts/get for example-maths prompt, receives prompt template with mathematical problem-solving instructions
client1 connects to CalcServer, calls eval_with_sampling(expression='2 + 2 * 3'), server uses sampling to evaluate expression and returns 8
client1 connects to CalcServer, subscribes to resource://special-number, client2 connects and calls write_special_number(value=50), client1 receives resource update notification
client1 connects to FileServer, calls resources/list with pagination (limit=2), receives first page with next_cursor, calls again with cursor to get remaining resources
client1 connects to FileServer, reads resource template file:///readme.txt using resource template, then calls write_file to update it, reads again to verify change
client1 connects to FileServer, subscribes to file:///watched.txt, then calls write_file to modify it, receives resource update notification
client1 connects to ErrorServer, calls always_error tool, receives proper error response with error code and message
client1 connects to ErrorServer, calls timeout tool with progress tracking enabled, sends cancellation after 1 second, receives cancelled acknowledgment
client1 connects to CalcServer via stdio transport, performs basic add operation, verifies stdio-specific message framing
client1 connects to CalcServer via SSE transport, performs add operation, verifies SSE event stream format and reconnection handling
client1 connects to CalcServer with progress tracking, calls eval_with_sampling with complex expression, receives progress notifications during evaluation
client1 connects to FileServer, server sends roots/list-changed notification, client calls roots/list and receives updated file system roots
client1 connects to CalcServer, enables server logging, performs several operations, calls logging/list to retrieve server-side logs
client1 connects to FileServer, lists prompts with pagination, gets prompt by name, then lists prompt templates and calls one with parameters
client1 connects to CalcServer via streamable-http transport, maintains session across multiple HTTP requests using session ID
client1 connects to FileServer, provides text completion context, server offers completion suggestions based on file content
client1 connects to CalcServer with older protocol version, server negotiates compatible version, operations proceed with negotiated version
client1 connects to CalcServer, calls tools/list with changed notification support, server notifies when tools change after set_trig_allowed
Three clients connect to CalcServer via different transports (stdio, SSE, streamable-http), all perform same operations and get consistent results
client1 connects to CalcServer, calls ambiguous_add, receives elicitation request but declines to provide input, receives appropriate error
client1 connects to CalcServer, initiates 3 concurrent add tool calls: add(1,2), add(3,4), add(5,6). Server processes them in parallel and returns results (3, 7, 11) maintaining request order
